criteria: Accuracy of plotting integers and rational numbers on a number line.
Accuracy of plotting pairs of integers and rational numbers on a coordinate plane.
Understanding and application of number line and coordinate plane concepts.
descriptions: No attempt or completely incorrect placement of numbers on the number line.
Plots only integers correctly or struggles with negative numbers.
Plots integers correctly but makes errors with rational numbers or negative signs.
Plots most integers and rational numbers correctly with minor errors in placement.
Accurately plots integers and rational numbers on a number line with clear and correct representation.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding by accurately plotting integers and rational numbers, including complex fractions and decimals, with precise placement and clear labeling.
No attempt or inability to plot points on a coordinate plane.
Struggles with plotting points, especially with negative coordinates.
Plots points with integer coordinates correctly but has difficulty with rational coordinates or negative signs.
Plots most points correctly, with minor errors in identifying the correct quadrant or position.
Accurately plots pairs of integers and rational numbers on a coordinate plane with correct quadrant identification and labeling.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of the coordinate plane by accurately plotting complex rational coordinates and explaining the relationship between coordinates and their position on the plane.
No understanding of number line or coordinate plane concepts is demonstrated.
Shows limited understanding of number lines and coordinate planes.
Understands basic concepts but struggles to apply them in plotting points.
Applies number line and coordinate plane concepts with some errors.
Applies number line and coordinate plane concepts accurately and effectively.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of number line and coordinate plane concepts by accurately plotting points and explaining the underlying principles.
